Notes: Bellot-Gurlet''s tables are not consistent. In his summary table, he lists 80 GDE obsidians, 57 of which are from period 2 phases. In fact, only 79 specimens are made out of GDE material, and only 56 pertain to period 2 phases. Notes: The analyses by Healey and Campbell 2007 simply compared whether colour could be used to identify source. Only percentages of correct guesses were given, which are quite strange - they do not correspond with whole numbers. For instance, 8 grey artefacts were guessed to be GDE, and according to the authors they were correct with a 32% accuracy. This would mean that 2.56 pieces of obsidian were accurately predicted in regards to their sources. One can not analyze 2.56 pieces of obsidian, and even if one can, why would you?
Citations: Healey, E. 2007; Campbell, S. et al 1999; Healey, E. and Campbell, S. 2007; Carter, E. et al 2003
Chemical Characterization: Healey, E. and Campbell, S. 2007; Healey, E. 2000:101-113
